body:
So currently trt_shape_function requires plugin factory to deserialize the engine; so does trt_conversion.
It does not seem clear to me how I can turn plugin factory into a header-only library to break the potential double import. It would be great if you could provide more details :)

Technically speaking, I can change trt_shape_function to use attributes to store output tensor shapes (required through TF static shape inference during segmentation) and avoid engine deserialization. 
This would work better with our optimization pass & last minute conversion during execution.

body_text:
So currently trt_shape_function requires plugin factory to deserialize the engine; so does trt_conversion.
It does not seem clear to me how I can turn plugin factory into a header-only library to break the potential double import. It would be great if you could provide more details :)
Technically speaking, I can change trt_shape_function to use attributes to store output tensor shapes (required through TF static shape inference during segmentation) and avoid engine deserialization.
This would work better with our optimization pass & last minute conversion during execution.
